and strength \add to\add* those who turn back \add the\add* battle \add at the\add* gate.

The Cornerstone of Zion
Therefore hear the word of Yahweh, men of mockery,
rulers of these people in Jerusalem:
Because you have said,
“We have ⸤made⸥\f + \fr 28:15 \ft Literally “cut” \f* a covenant with death,
and we have made an agreement with Sheol.
\add The\add* overwhelming flood, when it passes through, will not come to us,
for we have made lies\f + \fr 28:15 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f* our refuge,
and we have hidden ourselves in falsehood.”
Therefore the Lord Yahweh says this:
“Look! I \add am\add* laying a stone in Zion,
a ⸤tested⸥\f + \fr 28:16 \ft Literally “testing” \f* stone,
a precious cornerstone,
a founded foundation:
‘The one who trusts will not ⸤panic⸥.’\f + \fr 28:16 \ft Literally “hurry” \f*
And I will make justice \add the\add* measuring line,
and righteousness \add the\add* plumb line;
and hail will sweep away \add the\add* refuge of lies,\f + \fr 28:17 \ft Hebrew “lie” \f*
and waters will flood over \add the\add* hiding place.
And your covenant with death will be annulled,
and your agreement with Sheol will not stand;
you will become a trampling place for the overwhelming flood when it passes through.
⸤As often as it passes through⸥,\f + \fr 28:19 \ft Literally “From enough his passing through” \f* it will take you,
for ⸤morning by morning⸥\f + \fr 28:19 \ft Literally “in the morning in the morning” \f* it will pass through,
in the day and in the night,
and understanding \add the\add* message will be only terror.”
For the bed is too short ⸤to stretch out on⸥,\f + \fr 28:20 \ft Literally “from stretching oneself” \f*
and the covering is \add too\add* narrow when wrapping oneself.
For Yahweh will rise up as \add at\add* Mount Perazim;
he will rave as \add in the\add* valley at Gibeon
to do his deed—his deed \add is\add* strange—
and to work his work—his work \add is\add* alien!
And now you must not scoff,
or your bonds will be strong,
for I have heard from the Lord, Yahweh of hosts:
complete destruction
decreed upon all the land.
A Parable of Yahweh’s Work
Listen, and hear my voice!
Listen attentively, and hear my word!
Is it all day \add that\add* the plowman plows,
opens to sow seed, harrows his ground?
When he has leveled its ⸤surface⸥,\f + \fr 28:25 \ft Literally “face” \f* does he not scatter dill,
and sow cumin seed,
and ⸤plant⸥\f + \fr 28:25 \ft Literally “place” \f* wheat \add in\add* planted rows,\f + \fr 28:25 \ft Hebrew “row” \f*
and barley \add in\add* an appointed place,
and spelt grain \add as\add* its border?
And his God instructs him about the prescription;\f + \fr 28:26 \ft That is, “the proper way” \f*
he teaches him.
For dill is not threshed with \add a\add* threshing sledge,
nor is a wheel of a utility cart ⸤rolled⸥\f + \fr 28:27 \ft Literally “turned” \f* over cumin,
but dill is beaten out with \add a\add* stick,
and cumin with \add a\add* rod.
Grain is crushed fine,
but certainly one does not thresh it forever;
and one drives the wheel of his cart,
but his horses do not crush it.
This also comes forth from Yahweh of hosts.
He is wonderful \add in\add* advice;
he makes great wisdom.
